pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:0.5: 3. The training rule on swapping robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was using a robe she had received after swapping with another nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.3: But the other nun folded up the robe she had received and put it aside.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.5: “Venerable, where’s that robe that I swapped with you?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.6: She brought out the robe and showed it to her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.8: “Here’s your robe and give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours and that which is mine is mine. Give me that and take back what’s yours.” And she just took it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.9: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.10: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.11: “How could Venerable Thullanandā swap a robe with a nun and then take it back?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.12: Those nuns then told the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.13: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.14: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.17: “… How could the nun Thullanandā swap a robe with a nun and then take it back?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.18: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.19: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.20.1: ‘If a nun swaps robes with a nun and then says, “Here’s your robe; give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours, and that which is mine is mine. Give me that, and take back what’s yours;” and she just takes it or has it taken, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.8: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.10: much with little or little with much.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.12: if she just takes it herself, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.14: if she asks another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.15: If she only asks once, then even if the other takes back many, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.16: The robe-cloth is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.17: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.18: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.19: … ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth which I took back after swapping it with a nun is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.22: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained and she perceives her as such, and after swapping robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and after swapping robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and after swapping robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.4: If she swaps another requisite, and then takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.5: If she swaps robe-cloth or another requisite with someone who is not fully ordained, and then takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.8: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.2: if the other nun gives it back;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.3: if she takes it on trust from her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.6: The third training rule is finished.
